MSqb2 0.2.1

Annotate Protein Data with Gene Information

annotation_query.Rd

This function annotates protein data by fetching gene information either from a local file or by querying the UniProt API. The function is designed to handle protein accessions, split multi-accession inputs, and resolve gene names, optionally shortening long gene names for easier visualization.

Usage

annotation_query(
  dat,
  feature.annotation.source,
  uniprot.input = "Protein",
  uniprot.output = "Genes",
  uniprot.extra = NULL,
  uniprot.KEY = "UNIPROTKB",
  uniprot.species.name = NULL,
  uniprot.taxId = NULL,
  n.call = 99,
  uniprot.file = "AnnotationsTable.xlsx",
  shorten.gene.names = TRUE,
  split.char = ";",
  save.annotation = TRUE,
  save.annotation.path = Tables.path,
  Data.path = Data.path
)

Arguments

dat

A data table containing protein data with the columns specified by uniprot.input.

feature.annotation.source

Character string specifying the source of annotation. Options are "uniprot.file", already generated "annotation.file" from a previous run, or "uniprot".

uniprot.input

Character string specifying the column in dat containing protein accessions (default is "Protein").

uniprot.output

Character string specifying the type of output desired from UniProt, such as "Genes" (default) or any other valid UniProt field.

uniprot.extra

Optional additional UniProt fields to retrieve (default is NULL).

uniprot.KEY

The key type used for UniProt queries (default is "UNIPROTKB").

uniprot.species.name

Optional full species name used for UniProt queries (e.g., "Homo sapiens"). If not provided, uniprot.taxId must be given.

uniprot.taxId

Optional UniProt taxonomy ID for the species of interest.

n.call

Number of UniProt queries to make per batch (default is 99).

uniprot.file

Path to a saved local annotation file (default is "AnnotationsTable.xlsx").

shorten.gene.names

Logical indicating whether long gene names should be shortened (default is TRUE).

split.char

Character used to split multiple accessions (default is ";").

save.annotation

Logical indicating whether to save the retrieved annotations to a file (default is TRUE).

save.annotation.path

Path to the directory where the annotation file should be saved.

Data.path

Path to the directory where data files are stored.

Value

A data table containing the original data with an additional Genes column with the annotated gene names.

Details

The function handles different annotation sources:

  • "uniprot.file": Loads annotations from a previously saved Excel file.

  • "annotation.file": Reads annotations from a user-provided local file.

  • "uniprot": Queries UniProt directly to fetch annotations.

If the annotation source is "uniprot", either uniprot.taxId or uniprot.species.name must be provided to ensure accurate species-specific annotation.

The function can handle inputs where multiple accessions are present in a single cell (proteins groups), typically separated by ";", and can split them for more precise annotations.

Gene names can be optionally shortened for better readability, especially for visualizations.
